law.text:
Intoxication is a defense to a criminal charge only if such condition either:
Negatives the existence of an element of the offense; or
Is not voluntarily produced and deprives the defendant of substantial capacity either to appreciate the criminality of his conduct or to conform his conduct to the requirements of the law.
law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 18, effective January 1, 1975.
